biog.entry.name: O'CONNOR, the Hon. Brendan Patrick
biog.entry.description: Biography for O'CONNOR, the Hon. Brendan Patrick
biog.entry.electorate.name: Member for Gorton (Vic)
biog.entry.title: Biography for O'CONNOR, the Hon. Brendan Patrick
biog.entry.electorate.state.name: Member for Gorton (Vic)
biog.entry.party.name: Australian Labor Party

parliamentary.service.title: Parliamentary Service
parliamentary.service.para: Elected to the House of Representatives for Burke, Victoria, 2001. Re-elected following the 2003 electoral redistribution for Gorton, Victoria, 2004, 2007, 2010 and 2013.

ministerial.appointments.title: Ministerial Appointments
ministerial.appointments.para: Minister for Employment Participation from 3.12.07 to 9.6.09.
Minister for Home Affairs from 9.6.09 to 14.12.11.
Minister for Privacy and Freedom of Information from 14.9.10 to 14.12.11.
Minister for Human Services from 14.12.11 to 5.3.12.
Minister Assisting for School Education from 14.12.11 to 5.3.12.
Minister for Small Business from 5.3.12 to 4.2.13.
Minister for Immigration and Citizenship from 4.2.13 to 1.7.13.
Minister for Skills and Training from 1.7.13 to 18.9.13.

committee.service.title: Committee Service
committee.service.para: House of Representatives Standing: Employment and Workplace Relations from 16.2.04 to 31.8.04; Employment, Workplace Relations and Workforce Participation from 2.12.04 to 17.10.07 (Deputy Chair from 9.12.04 to 7.12.06); Library from 2.12.04 to 7.12.05; Education and Employment from 26.3.15.
Joint Statutory: Public Works from 20.3.02 (Deputy Chair from 21.3.02) to 17.10.07.
Joint Standing: Parliamentary Library from 27.3.06 to 17.10.07.

parliamentary.party.positions.title: Parliamentary Party Positions
parliamentary.party.positions.para: Shadow Parliamentary Secretary for Industrial Relations from 10.12.06 to 3.12.07.
Member, Opposition Shadow Ministry from 14.10.13. Shadow Minister for Employment and Workplace Relations from 18.10.13.

party.positions.title: Party Positions
party.positions.para: Chair, ALP Caucus Committee on Government Service Delivery from 2002.
Member, ALP Caucus Committees on Social Policy; and Economic Development and Living Standards from 2002.
Chair, Federal Labor Parliamentary Industrial Relations Taskforce from 2005.

quals.work.pre.parliament.title: Qualifications and Occupation before entering Federal Parliament
quals.work.pre.parliament.para: Assistant National Secretary, Australian Services Union 1993-2001.

electorate.title: Electorate
electorate.para: Location: north-western Melbourne; it includes the suburbs of Albanvale, Brookfield, Burnside, Cairnlea, Caroline Springs, Deer Park, Delahey, Derrimut, Exford, Hillside, Kings Park, Kurunjang, Melton, Melton South, Melton West, Mt Cottrell, Plumpton, Rockbank, Taylors Hill and Toolern Vale, and parts of Diggers Rest, Eynesbury, Plumpton and Truganina.
Industries: horse training and breeding facilities, retail and service industries.
State electorates: Gorton includes the Victorian Legislative Assembly electorate of Kororoit, and parts of Macedon, Melton, Sunbury and Sydenham.
